DataElement.preferredName: Nodule Atypical Adenomatous Lung Hyperplasia Or Adenocarcinoma In Situ Level of Confidence Finding Range
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Describes the expectation that a nodule is indolent and either AAH or AIS.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Nodule Atypical Adenomatous Lung Hyperplasia Or Adenocarcinoma In Situ Level of Confidence
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition:
A small lump, swelling or collection of tissue.:A preinvasive lesion in the lung. It is characterized by the presence of a small, localized proliferation of mildly to moderately atypical type II pneumocytes and/or Clara cells lining alveolar walls and sometimes respiratory bronchioles._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._A lesion in which the normally situated glands are partially or completely replaced by atypical cells with malignant characteristics._The percentage expectation that repeated tests or samples would yield the same results. It is affected by the method of testing and the sample size.
Isa: Statistical Technique

Concepts.definition: A small lump, swelling or collection of tissue.

Property.preferredName: Atypical Adenomatous Lung Hyperplasia Or Adenocarcinoma In Situ Level of Confidence
Property.preferredDefinition:
A preinvasive lesion in the lung. It is characterized by the presence of a small, localized proliferation of mildly to moderately atypical type II pneumocytes and/or Clara cells lining alveolar walls and sometimes respiratory bronchioles._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._A lesion in which the normally situated glands are partially or completely replaced by atypical cells with malignant characteristics._The percentage expectation that repeated tests or samples would yield the same results. It is affected by the method of testing and the sample size.
Isa: Statistical Technique

Concepts.definition: A preinvasive lesion in the lung. It is characterized by the presence of a small, localized proliferation of mildly to moderately atypical type II pneumocytes and/or Clara cells lining alveolar walls and sometimes respiratory bronchioles.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
A lesion in which the normally situated glands are partially or completely replaced by atypical cells with malignant characteristics.
The percentage expectation that repeated tests or samples would yield the same results. It is affected by the method of testing and the sample size.
